
[TITLE]
<line: 2> IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT 
<line: 3> FOR THE EASTERN DISTRICT OF PENNSYLVANIA 

[TITLE]
<line: 5> UNITED STATES OF AMERICA   

[TEXT]
<line: 7> CRIMINAL No. 17-62 

[TEXT]
<line: 9> v. 

[TITLE]
<line: 11> RAHEEM PLEASANT 

[TITLE]
<line: 13> ORDER 

[TEXT]
<line: 15> This 1st day of November, 2017, in consideration of the pre-trial motions filed by 
<line: 16> Defendant Raheem Pleasant and the Government, and any responses thereto, it is hereby 

[TITLE]
<line: 18> ORDERED that: 

[TEXT]
<line: 20> • Defendant’s Motion to Suppress Physical Evidence (Dkt. 37) is DENIED; 
<line: 21> • Defendant’s Motion to Suppress Out-of-Court Identifications (Dkt. 30) is DENIED; 
<line: 22> • Defendant’s Motion for Pretrial Lineup (Dkt. 29) is DENIED; 
<line: 23> • Government’s Motion to Admit Audio Recordings (Dkt. 17) is GRANTED; 
<line: 24> • Defendant’s Motion to Admit Full Recordings of Prison Phone Calls (Dkt. 38) is 
<line: 25> GRANTED; and 
<line: 26> • Government’s Motion to Admit Evidence under Rule 404(b) (Dkt. 23) is DENIED. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 28>                                                                         /s/ Gerald Austin McHugh__________ 
<line: 29> Gerald Austin McHugh 
<line: 30> United States District Judge
